CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 25, 1954, pg. 2, reads: "City's Oldest Resident's Birthday - Mrs. Sabra Washington, who is known fondly by her neighbors as 'Mother' Washington, celebrated her birthday Monday. She figures she's about 109.  Friends and neighbors held their annual affair for her at her home on Conemaugh Street where she lives with her nephew, Lee McDuffie... - Harris Photo." Cutline of image published again in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 22, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "Pittsburgh's Oldest Woman Succumbs - Mrs. Sabre Washington, known as "Mother" to her many friends, died at the age of 113 last Friday.  The ex-slave was born on a plantation near Nicholson, S. C., but had lived in Pittsburgh for many years.  The above pictures were taken before she was taken to the John J. Kane Hospital a few months ago where she died... - Harris photos."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of former slave Sabre "Mother" Washington on her 109th birthday, in her home on Conemaugh Street
